p: NoV causes non-bacterial gastroenteritis , especially among children [ 32]. The GII.4 genotype and its variants were mainly responsible for the numerous gastroenteritis outbreaks and sporadic cases for the last 20â€‰years [ 33]. However, new strains have emerged, and GII.17_2014 has assumed a significant epidemiological role for causing large outbreaks in Asian countries (replacing the GII.4 Sydney 2012 strain) with rapid spread to other parts of the world, which has alarmed the surveillance system of various regions [ 10, 14, 34].
